name: <(core::net::Ipv4Addr, u16) as net::socket_addr::ToSocketAddrs>::to_socket_addrs

core::net::SocketAddrV4::new.doc:
Creates a new socket address from an [`IPv4` address] and a port number.

 [`IPv4` address]: Ipv4Addr

 # Examples

 ```
 use std::net::{SocketAddrV4, Ipv4Addr};

 let socket = SocketAddrV4::new(Ipv4Addr::new(127, 0, 0, 1), 8080);
 ```

net::socket_addr::ToSocketAddrs::to_sock.doc:
Converts this object to an iterator of resolved [`SocketAddr`]s.

 The returned iterator might not actually yield any values depending on the
 outcome of any resolution performed.

 Note that this function may block the current thread while resolution is
 performed.
